Leaves: Diamond- to egg-shaped, to 35 x 20 cm, deeply lobed and with toothed edges.
Flowers: White or pale lavender, 6-10 cm long, trumpet-shaped.
FruitSeeds: Capsule 2-5 cm long, egg-shaped, erect, with many slender, irregular spines up to 2 cm long, releasing blackish, kidney-shaped, wrinkled seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Spines on the capsule shorter and flowers longer than in *Datura ferox*.
Impacts: Toxic to stock and humans, contaminates hay, outcompetes crop and native species.

Photos.Caption: Fruit splits to release black seeds
Flowers is usually white but centre can be purple/blue
